Rule 5.726.  Prospective adoptive parent designation (§§ 366.26(n), 16010.6)  (a) Request procedure   A dependent child’s caregiver may be designated as a prospective adoptive parent. (1) A request for designation as a prospective adoptive parent may be made at a hearing where parental rights are terminated or a plan of tribal customary adoption is ordered or thereafter, whether or not the child’s removal from the home of the prospective adoptive parent is at issue. (4) The address and telephone number of the caregiver and the child may be kept confidential by filing Confidential Information—Prospective Adoptive Parent (form JV-322), with form JV-321. Form JV-322 must be kept in the court file under seal, and only the court, the child’s attorney, the agency, and the child’s CASA volunteer may have access to this information.
